headline: From Founder Sales to Predictable Pipeline | US Market Entry for EU/UK SaaS Teams | 50+ Tech & SaaS Teams | GTM Strategist
summary: I donâ€™t start with retainers. I start with results. If your pipeline is stalling, your sales cycles are dragging, or your â€œgrowth planâ€ still relies on the founderâ€™s Rolodex, the problem isnâ€™t your team. Itâ€™s your system. Or lack of one. Most early-stage tech companies hit a plateau because they confuse motion with momentum. - They generate leads... but not sales conversations. - They hire reps... before fixing the funnel. - They enter the US market... with messaging that doesnâ€™t land. Hereâ€™s what most teams miss: â€œYou cannot succeed in your market without an intimate understanding of your ICP and why theyâ€™ll write you a check.â€ To catch the right fish, you need to be in the right place, at the right time, with the right bait. I teach you how. Iâ€™ve worked with over 50+ B2B SaaS and tech-enabled service companies, especially those in healthcare, financial services, and other regulated markets â€” to help them: - Multiply pipeline by 2â€“3Ã— - Cut sales cycles in half - Reduce CAC by 30â€“50% - Build outbound systems that actually generate sales conversations - Create repeatable sales processes that donâ€™t rely on heroics And I do it in a phased, capital-efficient way: Step 1 â€” ICP Sprint: Define and validate your highest-fit buyer segments, key decision makers, and messaging that resonates. Step 2 â€” Outreach Engine Build: Stand up a multichannel system (LinkedIn + email + content) that generates real conversations in less than 90 days. Step 3 â€” Revenue Ops Process: Establish a repeatable sales process, CRM, reporting, and enablement to convert conversations into revenue. Step 4 â€” Advisory: Once traction is proven, I step in to drive strategy, coach the team, and scale execution. ğŸ“¥ Want to see how this plays out in the real world? Check out the featured case study or watch the quick video overview. ğŸ“¥ Then book a 20-minute call when you're ready to break the plateau and build something that scales.

job_description: Helping founder-led B2B software & tech service companies break through growth plateaus with capital-efficient, scalable revenue engines. - Clarify and validate ICPs that convert - Craft buyer-centric messaging and outreach that lands meetings - Build repeatable pipeline and sales processes - Coach internal teams and lead GTM strategy as a trusted advisor Client Results Across 50+ Companies: - ARR scaled 24Ã— in 24 months - Sales cycle cut from 18 to 6 months - CAC reduced 30â€“50%, close rates up to 75% - Multiple US market entries for EU/UK SaaS firms Structured phased delivery: ICP Sprint â†’ Outreach Engine â†’ RevOps â†’ CRO
company_description: Greater Gain Group helps growth-stage B2B software and technical service companies build enterprise sales engines that deliver consistent, scalable revenue. We work with companies selling into highly regulated industries â€” healthcare, banking, financial services, and insurance â€” with a focus on North American market expansion. Our clients often say: â€œWe have a great product, but we canâ€™t get meetings with big companies.â€ â€œOur sales cycles are long, unpredictable, and founder-led.â€ â€œWeâ€™ve hired sales and marketing leaders before but nothing has stuck.â€ We solve these challenges by building repeatable go-to-market systems for complex enterprise sales cycles: â€¢ Enterprise Readiness Assessments â€¢ Market Positioning & Messaging â€¢ Go-to-Market Strategy Design â€¢ Enterprise Sales Process Development â€¢ CRM Discipline & Sales Accountability â€¢ Fractional & Interim CRO/Revenue Leadership â€¢ Investor and Board Advisory for PE/VC-backed growth â€¢ North American Market Entry Strategy Typical results include landing first major enterprise deals within 90 days, cutting sales cycles by 50%+, and increasing deal sizes 200%+. With 20+ years of experience selling into Fortune 500 buyers, Greater Gain Group combines real-world execution with hands-on leadership to help founders break through growth ceilings and build sustainable revenue engines. Beyond Growth. Greater Gain.

Our approach prioritizes understanding and leveraging individual strengths to develop unique leadership styles that positively influence corporate culture. We strive to create engaging workplaces where people are valued and appreciated, fostering an environment that employees are proud to be a part of. By focusing on the human aspect of organizations, we contribute to creating more effective teams, healthier work cultures, and ultimately, more successful businesses.

headline: Contract Executive, Fractional CHRO, C-Suite & Innovator Coach, Professional Speaker
summary: Serves as a catalyst to move leadership teams toward overcoming cycles of disappointment re: unrealized growth and transformation projects that donâ€™t deliver. The keys to sustainable success lie in objective examination of the mindset, decision making, culture, and measures of success that you think are working, but are holding you back from achieving your goals. Donâ€™t celebrate an â€œROIâ€ where youâ€™ve simply completed a project or covered project expensesâ€¦you are a leader(!); your growth metric is about changing the trajectory of growthâ€¦period. Thatâ€™s the â€œDeltaâ€ that matters. Finally, Todd helps companies stop the inward focus of the Human Resources function, linear thinking about change, and ignoring growth limiting habits just to chase the next new thing. Execution matters! Drives adoption of innovative and evidence-based practices in leading change, coaching key leaders, and distilling the best leadership guidance into practical, easy-to-adopt keys to unlocking performance. Uses data and strategic insight to help leadership teams see into gaps which slow growth or result in change failures. Todd has been awarded the only U.S. Patent for Leading Indicators of Change Management Success, and brought Agile Leadership Team profiles to market. Delivers executive coaching which is tailored to the unique demands placed upon leaders of innovation and change. Hands-on experience driving business outcomes as an HR Officer in the Healthcare, Financial Services, and Hospitality industries. Top-Ten Specialties: Change Management Business Transformation Leader & Organization Agility Human Capital Planning Executive Coaching Talent Management Leadership Development Succession Management Organization Development Building Leadership Teams

Our 3,500 students learn in small classes with faculty experts who are deeply invested in their success. Just a 30-minute train ride from downtown Chicago, our beautiful arboretum campus offers students a home away from home and a place to belong. On July 1, 2020, we officially changed our name from Elmhurst College to Elmhurst University.

headline: Executive and Leadership Coach â™¦ Leadership Team Coach â™¦ Public Speaker and Facilitator â™¦ Non-Profit Board Leader and Founder
summary: I'm Kat, a Finnish-American ICF-certified executive and leadership team coach, facilitator, and speaker with 25+ years of experience in global organizational and leadership development. I help leaders and organizations create a culture of inclusion and psychological safety where innovation thrives. My masterâ€™s degree in Mental Health Counseling informs my holistic, research-backed coaching framework. Together, we explore new perspectives and identify solutions for growth and success as well as health and well-being. In 1998, I moved from my native Finland to New York City. I was the first in my family to earn a college degree and, like many others, I craved the energy, inspiration, and diversity of life in NYC. I held career services and HR & development roles before founding my independent coaching practice. My expertise lies in international and highly-demanding professional contextsâ€”since founding my practice, my work has taken me to Helsinki, Rome, Bangkok, and Bonn and Iâ€™ve worked with leaders based across six continents. Sisuâ€”the Finnish concept of resilienceâ€”and my own personal experiences as an immigrant have deeply influenced my coaching philosophy. My approach to coaching is built upon a core belief in our human capacity to learn and grow, to succeed through challenges, and live and lead with purpose. Alongside my coaching practice, I am an experienced senior non-profit founder and board leader. I have founded, led, and developed several global and local non-profit community organizations over the past 30 years. After I moved to NYC, I founded two non-profit organizations with and for Nordic women. I have served as vice-president for a global non-profit FIGT.org, and the local Finnish American Chamber of Commerce in NYC. I led the Chatham High School Marching Band Club, a registered 501c3, as President for several years. As a leader, I am driven by my values to make a difference by strengthening communities through engagement. In all my leadership experiences, I have improved the performance and structure of the boardâ€”I am a skilled organizer known for getting things done. I lead with a strong vision and clear goals while building engagement and motivation through communication and relationship building. Want to learn more about working with me as your executive or team coach and facilitator? Send me a note!

headline: Fractional HR Executive | Human Resources Consultation | Executive Coach | Developer of Leaders
summary: Executive Human Resources and Business Leader, Consultant and Coach with extensive experience driving company culture, innovating state-of-the-art systems and processes for Human Capital improvements, and collaborating with enterprise-wide leaders to attract, develop, and retain talent. Adept at developing trusting relationships, leading and optimizing high-performing teams, and coaching individuals to maximize performance and potential. A talented organizational and interpersonal communicator with a strategic mindset, an extraordinary level of empathy, and hands-on engagement in aligning strategic and operational goals to achieve superior results. PROFESSIONAL COMPETENCIES Strategic Planning & Alignment â€¢ Leadership & Employee Dev. â€¢ Organizational / Succession Planning â€¢ Subsidiary Creation / Management â€¢ Talent Acquisition / Evaluation â€¢ Board / Compensation Committee â€¢ Managing Organizational Change â€¢ Mentoring & Coaching â€¢ Performance-Based Metrics VALUE PROPOSITION I've been told that I am a business man in an HR Leaders body. I align the people operations strategy to the business strategy because a business will exceed its goals when it helps its employees and leaders become the most productive versions of themselves. SELECTED ACCOMPLISHMENTS â€¢ Led the development and rollout of a culture-focused priority-driven leadership goals program at Plexus, tied projects to key business strategies that held leaders accountable critical business deliverables, and set the long-term transition to equity-based pay for performance. â€¢ Led the process of establishing a state-of-the art talent assessment tool for C-Suite leaders at Plexus This process created 9-boxes for every C-Suite member, established workforce planning for lower performers, and created the long-term developmental framework for focusing on the development of staff and successors. â€¢ Collaborated with the Board of Directors at TGen to launch a faculty incentive program that lead to scientific innovation, increased the number of submitted grants, publications, and service, and boosted revenue for the Institute. â€¢ Directed comprehensive research focused on making research operations more efficient at TGen, led cross-functional teams to identify ways to apply monetary awards for efficiency. Program resulted in $186,000 over 2 years, and motivated leaders to find additional opportunities to save. PERSONAL When I am not working, I am blessed with the privilege of being a martial arts and soccer dad. Otherwise, you can find me hiking, building furniture, or watching baseball.
